etymology.description: Semantic 歹(歹) (dǎi, "vicious, bones") + Phonetic 戔(戔) (jiān) -> to viciously harm, injure
etymology.interpretation: The character 殘(cán) represents the concept of causing harm or destruction through a combination of a semantic component, 歹(歹) (dǎi, "vicious, bones"), which conveys the idea of viciousness or death, and a phonetic component, 戔(戔) (jiān), indicating the sound. The semantic aspect underscores the destructive meaning inherent in the character.
etymology.simplification: Simplified as 残(残) with the component 歹(歹) retained while other parts were simplified.

examples.chinese: 暴风雨殘害了古树(暴風雨殘害了古樹)。
examples.pinyin: Bào fēng yǔ cán hài le gǔ shù.
examples.english: The storm damaged the ancient tree.

examples.chinese: 工人不小心殘了文物(工人不小心殘了文物)，博物馆立即展开修复(博物館立即展開修復)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngrén bù xiǎoxīn cán le wénwù, bówùguǎn lìjí zhǎnkāi xiūfù.
examples.english: The workers accidentally damaged the cultural relics, and the museum immediately began repairs.

examples.chinese: 不当操作殘害了电脑(不當操作殘害了電腦)，数据全部丢失(數據全部丟失)。
examples.pinyin: Bùdāng cāozuò cán hài le diànnǎo, shùjù quánbù diūshī.
examples.english: Improper operation damaged the computer, and all the data was lost.
